comments:
I'm sure this is timing related, so may be hard to reproduce, but thought I'd 
report it, in case anyone's counting "hard to reproduce" bugs. 

I started a debug "run", it swithed to debug perspective, I opened a file before 
it was fully running. About the time the editor opened, the debugger hit its 
first breakpoint (so filled the stack pane) but the outline view was not 
"updated" for current file, it still showed outline from previous file. Closing 
the file and reopening it worked as expected, the correct outline view was 
displayed. I marked as minor, since only saw once. If happends more frequently, 
I'll upgrade to 'normal'.

Was there something in .log?
Does close and reopen the Outline fix it?
Which build?

Sorry I forgot to say, it was on 0506 build. And, there was something in log!

The first exception may be unrelated (there were a number of them in my log) 
but thought I'd include it, in case related. The second one is pretty obviously 
related. Thanks.

The debug stack trace shows that we failed to install a breakpoint due to a 
timeout. The other stack shows an editor was accessing UI code in a non-UI 
thread. Moving to PDE for comment.
This code has changed as of 3.1
